Having just delighted audiences as John Campbell in Be My Baby, Chip is a veteran actor who has been seen on many local and Pittsburgh stages over the past 40+ years. A past president of OPAC, he works at UPMC/Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic – Comprehensive Recovery Services as the Director of Service Coordination. Last season Chip was Mel Edison in Prisoner of Second Avenue and reprised a role of 25 years ago, Abe, in Squabbles. He is delighted to share the stage with his buddy Rick and sister-in-law Pat, and to be directed again by Thom McLaughlin. Favorite AHP roles include Willie Clark (The Sunshine Boys), Nat (I’m Not Rappaport), and Big Daddy (Cat on a Hot Tin Roof), a role that garnered him the Pittsburgh Post Gazette’s “Best Featured Male Actor on Suburban Stages” in 2009.
